paper.title: Attack on Han et al.'s ID-based confirmer (undeniable) signature at ACM-EC'03

paper.abstract: In ACM conference on electronic commerce (ECu002703), Han et al. [Identity-based confirmer signatures from pairings over elliptic curves, in: Proceedings of ACM Conference on Electronic Commerce Citation 2003, San Diego, CA, USA, June 09-12, 2003, pp. 262-263] proposed an ID-based confirmer signature scheme using pairings (the scheme is in fact an ID-based undeniable signature scheme). In this paper, we show that this signature scheme is not secure and the signer can deny any signature, even if it is a valid signature, and any one can forge a valid confirmer signature of a signer with identity ID on an arbitrary message and confirm this signature to the verifier.
